Story Design Volume 20 - In a decline-and-fall story, the protagonist starts out in a high position, possessed of fortune and glory, having everything they could ever desire. This could be literal or metaphorical; they might have moral or ethical riches rather than money and possessions. The protagonist then proceeds to lose it all through corruption, greed, and general foolishness. Their decline is seen as a form of justice or punishment for some bad behavior they’ve engaged in.

Examples of the decline and fall plot include A Clockwork Orange, Crime and Punishment, The Godfather, Gone with the Wind, and Paradise Lost.

Story Design: Decline-and-Fall covers all of the elements you need to prepare in order to tell a story of tragic descent. It's based on concepts explored in Story Structure for Writers and Roleplayers, also published by Dancing Light Press. It's a big book that goes into greater detail on how to get the most out of the three-act structure, as well as developing a three-phase series (campaign, if you prefer) with a clear beginning, middle, and end. If you want to use your favorite roleplaying game system to tell stories with more depth than kill monster, get treasure, repeat (not that there's anything wrong with that), it is worth looking into.

220769.name: M.E.R.C.
220769.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be it an individual villain, group, or organization, each Enemy Strike File Source Book details a villainous organization for use with your SUPERS! Revised Edition roleplaying game. Each organization is extensively detailed allowing it to be easily integrated into your games; be it a one-shot gaming session to an ongoing campaign.

Welcome to what I hope to be the first in a series of sourcebooks detailing the various organizations inhabiting the New Millennium Universe. In this first volume, we’re providing information on the villainous organization known as M.E.R.C., or more formally as the Military Enterprises and Research Corporation. Within its covers you’ll find information on the group’s history, its organization, its personnel and equipment, some of its more important personalities, tips on integrating M.E.R.C. into an ongoing campaign, as well as a few short plot seeds for Judges to make use of.

220770.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the Ticket to Ride Rails and Sails game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the pieces and the cards from the base game.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are also choice cards which may help or hinder you.

There are bonuses to give you extra points.

There are new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn.
220770.name: Black Sea (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride: Rails & Sails)

220771.name: Crypt of the Cultists
220771.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A three to five hour adventure for 2nd level characters.

The party is hired to investigate suspicious activity in the local graveyard. Inside the ancient crypt at the center of the graveyard, they discover a sinister cult intent on awakening an ancient evil... or at least a bunch of skeletons and zombies!

User summary:

Includes several pages of full-color, print-and-play, maps.

220772.name: Wayfarer (2nd Edition)
220772.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Wayfarer! This is a game system which is used for a series of short gamebooks where you can explore a world of fantasy and magic, grow your character and perform great deeds. The idea of the system is to be simple, yet flexible.

User summary:

This book provides a simple methodology for solitaire roleplaying. Characters are defined by several narrative tags. Action resolution uses a simple die roll, though re-rolls are sometimes allowed.

Note the first edition of this game was titled Legend of the Wayfarer.

220774.name: Codenames Marvel Edition
220774.description:
In Codenames, two teams compete to see who can guess all of their words correctly first — but those words are hiding in plain sight in a 5x5 grid that includes the words of the other team, neutral words, and an assassin that will cause you to lose the game immediately if you guess it. One person on each team is a spymaster and only these two know which words belong to each team. Spymasters take turns giving one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess words of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team — and everyone wants to avoid the assassin.

Codenames Marvel Edition keeps the Codenames gameplay, while featuring characters and locations from the Marvel Comics universe.

220775.name: Codenames Disney Family Edition
220775.description:
In Codenames, two teams compete to see who can guess all of their words correctly first — but those words are hiding in plain sight in a 5x5 grid that includes the words of the other team, neutral words, and an assassin that will cause you to lose the game immediately if you guess it. One person on each team is a spymaster and only these two know which words belong to each team. Spymasters take turns giving one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the board. Their teammates try to guess words of the right color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team — and everyone wants to avoid the assassin.

Codenames Disney Family Edition keeps the Codenames gameplay, while featuring characters and locations from a variety of Disney and Pixar films.

220776.name: Dragon Punch (Issue 1 - Jan 2017)
220776.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Dragon Punch Magazine è la prima rivista fanmade per Musha Shugyo RPG che raccoglie decine di news, interviste, recensioni, approfondimenti, Setting Pack e download gratuiti sul mondo di MS e dei giochi che ci ruotano attorno! Una vera miniera d'oro di materiale giocabile per il sistema di Musha Shugyo RPG!
Lo scopo della rivista è quello di catalogare tutto l’enorme materiale disponibile in rete per Musha Shugyo ma al momento estremamente frammentato. I vari blog sono stati contattati e hanno fornito il permesso per l’uso dei contenuti postati sulle loro pagine!

Questa fanzine è il risultato dell’entusiasmo e della passione dei fan di Musha Shugyo e di tutti i blogger appassionati di GDR che ne hanno parlato. Ringrazio tutti vuoi per aver generato, spontaneamente, l’incredibile montagna di materiale ora a nostra disposizione: era ora di fare un po’ di ordine!

Se vi piace quel che leggete, ricordate che sostenendoci darete una mano non solo a Dragon Punch Magazine ma anche ai fan che vogliono pubblicare i loro giochi basati su Musha tramite l'etichetta Dragon Punch Publishing. La rivista è in Pay What you Want, ma è solo donando qualche spicciolo che ci permetterete di volare sempre più in alto e fare grandi cose in futuro.

In questo numero:
MS News

Dragon Punch pubblicherà i tuoi GDR!
Tutte le ultime news della Community di Musha Shugyo
HAWAT GDR: Il punto della situazione
DGI GDR Awards 2016: Vincono NOI / LORO e C’era una volta una Palude per Darkmoor
HAWAT GDR: Crea la tua fazione!

Approfondimenti e Moduli Extra

MUSHA SHUGYO: TRASFORMA QUALUNQUE GIOCO ARCADE IN UN GDR
Legami tra Destino Oscuro e Musha Shugyo RPG
L’importanza di chiamarsi Critico!
Oracolo e Nuove Statistiche Interpretative

Interviste e Recensioni

H.A.W.A.T, un mondo ostile che a tutti quanti paura fa...
Agon World War II Intervista a M.M.
Rotten Core: c’è del marcio in Musha Shugyo
Recensione di Darkmoor Roleplaying Game
Noi / loro: prendi a calci l’apocalisse ! La Recensione

Setting Pack e Dintorni

HAWAT GDR Powered by Musha Shugyo RPG: presentazione
C’era una volta una Palude: Presentazione
Horrywood Project
Presentazione Augusta Universalis
NOI / LORO GDR, il MiniSetting horror che divenne GDR completo
Ninja Saga: presentazione
Una nave incagliata su un fiume: 5 Incipit per H.A.W.A.T. Gdr
Darkmoor: Herode Saberpunk!
NOI / LORO GDR: Eteronomicon
Star Wars Setting Pack

220777.name: Reclamation of Phlan
220777.description:
From the introduction:

For too long, the Maimed Virulence had held Phlan in its grasp. The factions have begun to muster and sounded the call to battle throughout the Moonsea. Allies new and old will be called upon to aid in their attempts to reclaim the ancient town. Are you one of the few bold enough to answer the call to battle?

A four-hour Epic adventure for 1st - 16th level characters.

220778.name: Sticky Chameleons
220778.description:
Description from the publisher:

Playing with sticky tongues has never been more fun than what you'll find in Sticky Chameleons!

220779.name: Reclamation of Phlan: Administrative Guidance
220779.description:
From the introduction:

This document provides guidance on running DDEP4: Reclamation of Phlan, a DDEP - D&D Epic Adventures adventure.

220780.name: Fairy Tile
220780.description:
Description from the publisher:

Accomplish secret missions in Fairy Tile and create your own story with characters from a fairy-tale world.

220781.name: Sentaï Cats
220781.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sentaï Cats is a quirky semi-cooperative card game of cats and dogs.

220782.name: Adventures in Middle-earth Pregenerated Characters
220782.description:
User summary:

This item presents six pregenerated characters. Each character consists of a full-color, full-page art and description and a full-page character sheet, intended for double-sided print-and-play use. The set includes:


Bardings - Lifstan, son of Leiknir (Warrior 1)
Beornings - Beran of the Mountains (Warden 1)
Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain - Beli (Treasure Hunter 1)
Elves of Mirkwood - Caranthiel (Scholar 1)
Hobbits of the Shire - Trotter (Wanderer 1)
Woodmen of Wilderland - The Bride (Slayer 1)

220783.name: Adventures in Middle-earth Character Sheet
220783.description:
User summary:

This black-and-white, two-page character sheet is intended for print-and-play use. It is provided as a free download.

220784.name: The Legend of the Cherry Tree that Blossoms Every Ten Years
220784.description:
Description from the publisher:

Hito Hira is an elegant game of press-your-luck and set collection with breathtaking visuals.

220785.name: Legal Cannabis
220785.description:
Description from the publisher:

The era of black gold is over. An alternative to oil has existed for centuries: CANNABIS.

You find unoccupied land where CANNABIS grows in abundance. You purchase your first tractors right away. Your crops allow you to build factories that process the CANNABIS into several products. These products lead to contracts that bring in gold.

Beware of criminals who want to farm your CANNABIS. Protect yourself with the help of police.

Think and sow the CANNABIS seeds that will grow on your land. Build your factories at the right time and you will earn copious amounts of gold. Rise to the challenge by growing this natural resource!

EXPAND DESCRIPTION :
Buy land to sow cannabis seeds and harvest cannabis. Build factories to make products. Transport the products with trucks to win cards. Each card equals one gold coin. The winner is the first player who collect 4 gold coins.

220786.name: Echoes and Death
220786.description:
User Summary

When your town is overrun by the walking dead, there's only one thing left to do...

220787.name: Sky Sanctuary
220787.description:
Take a stroll in a peaceful VR sanctuary high in the clouds. Empty your mind, focus and unleash your combat skills. With your robot companion, explore the archipelago to reveal its secrets and become a true samurai.

Source: The Game Website.

220788.name: Treehouse Basketball
220788.description:
Treehouse Basketball is a free basketball simulator designed for the HTC Vive. Shoot free throws or play a quick 30-second timed challenge and see how many baskets you can sink.

Source: The Game Website.

220789.name: TAIKU MANSION
220789.description:
Trapped. Isolated. Alone. Use your cunning wit and intelligence to survive the puzzles lay in front of you by a mysterious figure. Escape from the mansion before dawn or face your demise. Do you have what it takes?

Source: The Game Website.

220790.name: Animal Lover
220790.description:
User Summary

Evil forces have turned these five hunky beefcake time-displaced boys into animals! You've got to help cure them and maybe even fall in love!

220791.name: Skyling: Garden Defense
220791.description:
A fun and frantic maze game with classic arcade style.

Source: The Developer Website.

220792.name: The Expanse Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28. Devon Dice Podcast part 2, Show packed full of content.
220792.description:
The Expanse, a board game based on the Syfy television series of the same name, focuses on politics, conquest and intrigue similar to the board game Twilight Struggle, although with a shorter playing time. The card-driven game uses key images from the show, along with action points and events that allow players to move and place "Fleets" and "Influence".

In more detail, players represent Earth's UN forces, the military of Mars, the rebels of the O.P.A., and the mysterious corporation Protogen Inc. Each player has special abilities that must be maneuvered to gain advantage. Players increase their control over the solar system using characters and events from the universe of The Expanse.

220793.name: Vanpi-ru
220793.description:
User summary
ヴァンピール (Vanpi-ru) is a Werewolf-style game with one player being the Vampire and the others as villagers. Players are working to get their colour to be the strongest by playing cards to the table. However, villagers can be infected to become a Vampire and can be cured (the original Vampire is immune).

220794.name: Holy Potatoes! We're in Space?!
220794.description:
In Holy Potatoes! We're in Space?!, explore a veggie-filled universe with Cassie and Fay on their journey to rescue their grandfather, Jiji! Defeat your enemies in strategic turn-based combat, manage your very own spaceship, and explore dozens of procedurally generated planets, stars and galaxies!

Source: The Developer Website.

220795.name: Worldcrafting
220795.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is Worldcrafting, a collection of essays describing the process of creating an RPG game world. Although it refers to Savage Worlds game mechanics, it’s system-independent. And the book contains essays by other experienced authors and designers, too.

220796.name: Mysteries of Passion
220796.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Pathfinder RPG customer who wants a little more, Everyman Gaming is proud to introduce Everyman Minis! Uniting several high-quality Pathfinder RPG freelancers under a single product line, each week a different Everyman Gaming author or freelancer tackles an exciting new topic by creating a miniature product specially designed to scratch that product’s particular itch.

This installment of Everyman Minis includes: 1,000 words discussing the passion mystery, a new oracle mystery focused on charm, romance, and lust.

220797.name: Atacama
220797.description:
User Summary

Based on the game "Atacama" from the company Mucke Spiele

Excitement in the Atacama! Valuable mineral resources — gold, silver and copper — have been found in the 1,200 km long desert in Chile and Peru along the coast of the Pacific Ocean. Several companies are already busy prospecting by erecting huge drilling rigs as the resources are deep under the surface. Due to security reasons, the drilling rigs cannot be installed too close to one another, so each new rig limits the possibilities for erecting new ones in the surrounding areas.

What’s more, the mining rights have been limited by the government. The companies have received a concession for only two of the three commodities – and extracting the “wrong” type of commodity will result in penalties. Becoming rich is a difficult business, but the stakes are worthwhile.

220798.name: Fowl Play!
220798.description:
User Summary

Intro-duck-tion:
This is an implementation of the game "Fowl Play!" designed by Richard Breese and published by "R&D Games" and uses the graphics by Juliet Breese

In the game each player controls a fox. Using it fox, a player will try to capture Using it fox, a player will try to capture some of each of the types of fowl that are found in the farm yard: chickens, ducks, geese and turkeys.
Foxes need a balanced diet!

Each player uses their fox to capture some of each of the types of fowl (chickens, ducks, geese and turkey) that are found in the farmyard. Players gain points for the fowl they have captured and also for saving from capture those fowl that share one or more of the same characteristics as their chosen target card.

Each round every player chooses to play one of their three fowl cards to determine turn order and which of the fowl counters a player can move. Players may move up to three fowl counters a combined total of up to three spaces on the hex shaped board. Players will choose whether to assist their own fox in capturing the fowl, or whether to save their secret target fowl and similar fowl from being caught by the other players’ foxes. Foxes then move up to two spaces in an attempt to capture one of the fowl. Moving the foxes through the foxholes will speed their progress and allow the foxes to creep up on the fowl unnoticed.

The game usually finishes when eight or fewer fowl remain at the end of a round. The target cards are then revealed, the points tallied (the most difficult part of the game) and a winner declared.

In this implementation of the game the player can play up to 3 AI players in 3 Different levels. There is no online possibility or multiple human players.

220799.name: Centica Primer
220799.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Centica is a land bleeding from a thousand wounds. Its people are a feuding superstitious race, ever tending the sacred pools as their ancestors admonished. Blood sacrifice appeases the tribal gods - warlike Centica and her demi-sons Conn and Colla.

Now the Centics face destruction. Storms thrash and boom as fleets of Ivirate warships darken the horizon. Bolstered by sorcery and the strength of half the world, they come to conquer.

But beyond the holy pools lurk dimensions of beauty and terror. Seductive realms of horror, hiding artefacts that might turn the tide of war.

Centica Primer is a concise, system free, campaign setting for Game Masters who can customise from core concepts.

220800.name: Macchiato Monsters ZERO
220800.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Macchiato Monsters is a rules-light, old school, slightly collaborative roleplaying game. I designed it for adventure, exploration and survival in all kinds of perilous dungeonverses.

Key features:


Classless characters
Freeform magic
One-roll combat rounds
Risk dice: a simple attrition mechanic

220801.name: Shipwreck
220801.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 340th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a shipwreck in the shallows, at low tide.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

220802.name: Desert Road Junction
220802.description:
From publisher blurb:

220803.name: Horror Stories
220803.description:
From the introduction:

Horror Stories (Genre Structure Vol. 1) helps you to develop and tell frightful tales of dread and darkness. It is an essential sourcebook for creating fiction and tabletop adventures. Written for writers and roleplayers, with clear step-by-step instructions, you can:


Determine which horror genre elements you wish to include in your story
Work with a variety plot types to create a story that is unique and original to you
Structure a scary beginning, middle, and end to your tale
Deconstruct existing stories to remix and reimagine elements for use in your own story


User summary:

Presents methods for fiction writing and adventure design. Includes several short fiction samples.

From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 334th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the tree crowns of a dense forest.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

220825.name: Solo Gaming Rules
220825.description:
From the introduction:

Solo Gaming Rules is a role-playing game system designed for solo play. No system is easier to learn. Solo Gaming Rules does have substance and can be played with these rules alone as an RPG if that is what you want. If you are a firm solo gamer, this game can be molded to your tastes in gaming. It can be used in any solo involving high tech, low tech (fantasy), monsters and magic, and many other things. Give it a chance, and I think you will find it to be what you are looking for.

220826.name: Roleplaying Emotion
220826.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes the hardest thing to do in a tabletop roleplaying game is engage with the roleplaying part. It's not that we have a shortage of ideas on how our characters would behave. Their abilities aren't a mystery to us, and we know how to use them to our tactical advantage. Things break down when we have to perform the characters. As people. In character. With feelings and reactions and all of that messy, potentially embarrassing stuff.

220827.name: Planet Apocalypse
220827.description:
It is the End Times, and the hordes of Hell are invading our world. Destroy the Hellgate & save our world!

Planet Apocalypse is a cooperative game. The players battle and kill demons as a team. The game is primarily a battle game, but also has a tower-defense element, and a roleplaying element as you build up your hero's over time.

It has large high-quality plastic figures, scaled to 28mm so they can be used in other games.

220828.name: Plane Shift: Kaladesh
220828.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Welcome, one and all! Right this way! Open your eyes, your ears, and your imaginations to the wonders of the Inventors' Fair!"

—Herald of the Inventors' Fair

If the optimism, innovation, and spirit of creativity pervading the world of Kaladesh kindled your drive for adventure, we have what you're looking for. If The Art of Magic: The Gathering—Kaladesh made you long to experience the aether-swept landscapes and brilliant inventions of Magic's latest plane for yourself, these pages have what you need. Like a renegade inventor tinkering in a secluded workshop, author James Wyatt has crafted a set of rules to bring your Dungeons & Dragons adventures to life on Kaladesh, including new races, new monsters, and a distinctly aether-flavored take on crafting the marvelous and ingenious magic items that define this plane.

220829.name: Revolve
220829.description:
Revolve is a Triggeractive Platformer. You have no direct control and need to use boosts, gravity & momentum to escape a dystopian...

Source: The Game Website.

220830.name: BOOR
220830.description:
BOOR is a 2D puzzle-platformer game, where you play as a girl with the ability to multiply herself, stranded on Eden, a beautiful but strange world, full of challenging puzzles with platforming elements and a refreshing gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

220831.name: Among the Innocent: A Stricken Tale
220831.description:
Among the Innocent is a first-person adventure thriller that takes place on an abandoned farm in the eastern Free State, South Africa. The gameplay is inspired by classic point-and-click adventure games, and is packed with intrigue, puzzle-solving, and exploration.

Source: The Game Website.

220832.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 49 - May 1999)
220832.description:
From the cover:
Pokemon Invasion! Monster Strategies & Price Guide
SCI-FI Spectacular: Online Games you want to see!
Star Wars
Star Trek
Babylon 5

220833.name: Top Cop
220833.description:
From publisher site:

Fast action, as cops patrol the city on a crime wave alert!

With cops playing as pieces, players search for clues to capture 9 criminals on the WANTED list. Clues found on patrol are pegged on the Big City game board. 1st to capture 3 robbers is TOP COP.

Synopsis:
On your turn, if there are not 3 "WANTED Posters" (cards) displayed, you draw one from the tray. There must always be 3 WANTED Posters displayed at all times during the game. You move your piece along the board, collecting clues on the spaces where you land, and match the clues up with items from the WANTED Posters. Once you have collected all 3 clues from one of the Posters, you have caught the criminal in that poster. The first player to capture 3 criminals is the TOP COP.

220834.name: The Wondrous Hoard (S&W)
220834.description:
From publisher blurb:

There once lived a Moon Sage in a wondrous palace. Dilimbabbar — for such was his name — was a leader of armies and a scholar of the night sky. In his palace, he collected wondrous things and hoarded riches beyond belief. He summoned servants from the ether and demons from the earth to bring treasures no mortal eyes had ever seen. But that was long ago, before the flood washed over the lands.

Now, the Sage is lost to an unknown fate, his powers having faltered. Yet his palace remains, brimming with wealth locked away in the vacant halls.

...or so travelers say, telling tales to each other under starlit skies.

The Wondrous Hoard was originally published for Blood & Bronze. This version has been reworked and expanded for compatibility with Swords & Wizardry.

220836.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Estrella Drive
220836.description: T.I.M.E Stories: Estrella Drive, the sixth T.I.M.E Stories expansion, is about show business in Hollywood, California.

220838.name: theHunter: Call Of The Wild
220838.description:
User Summary

Experience the thrill of the hunt in a visually breathtaking, technically groundbreaking, vast open world.

220839.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Frères de la Côte
220839.description: T.I.M.E Stories: Frères de la Côte, the seventh T.I.M.E Stories expansion, is about pirates in the 17th century.

220841.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 55 - Nov 1999)
220841.description:
On the Cover:
Halloween Extravaganza
Evil Pokemon
Magic's Juzam Djinn
Magic: The Gathering Mercadian Masques Preview
Two-Headed "Shivan" Dragon!
Awesome 6/6 Wumpass!
and much more!
How to Surviv Diablo II

220842.description:
The Dwarf Giants Dice Set

Set includes 7 Blood Bowl dice:

Blocking Dice x3
d6 x2
d8 x1
d12 x1
220842.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Dwarf Giants Dice Set

220843.name: Overworld
220843.description:
HOOK: Diceless tile placement/area control game for 2-4 with a retro videogame flair, all in a super-portable package.

DESCRIPTION: In every classic JRPG, the heroes encountered a mysterious stranger, who gave them a map to a dungeon, and stocked them with potions, keys, and other provisions. But how was the map drawn? How did the wise stranger learn of all these dire warnings? In Overworld, you are the hero's mysterious mentor. All those years before you sent the hero to the underworld, you mapped the Overworld!

By laying tiles, you will seek to claim regions of Forests or Mountains with your Tent meeples, and regions of Shoals or Deep Sea with your Ship meeples. When the tiles form a hole in the world, the player who explored the most tiles there will place a Dungeon Door meeple into the hole.

Can your foresee uncertain spots in the geography, indeterminate in the distance? Will you uncover a dungeon... or wander the repeating pixel textures forever?

GAMEPLAY: Players in Overworld will take turns placing L-shaped tiles, one at a time, drawn from a bag. Place it land-side up or water-side up, but water and land may not be adjacent. Or instead, play a Coast tile that connects land to water. Enclosing an empty gap with tiles will place a dungeon door meeple from whichever player has explored the most tiles in that area.

The player whose dungeon entrance meeples are the farthest apart has discovered the largest and most valuable dungeon!

220844.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 100 - Feb 2017)
220844.description:
Treasures await the intrepid.

For years, Pyramid – the PDF magazine for roleplayers – has delivered monthly delights to your gaming table. In this, our 100th issue, we bring you material that spans the possibilities of GURPS in all its amazement. "Infinite Weapons" arms you with new GURPS High-Tech firearms you might find across the GURPS Infinite Worlds setting. This month's column from David L. Pulver reveals new organizations and possibilities conjured from the pages of GURPS Ultra-Tech. Secrets and surprises are waiting for you in this anniversary issue!

- Publisher's description

220845.name: The Clockwork Crimes
220845.description:
[Synopsis from pdf]

Gas lamps pour fitful light through the fog-shrouded streets of 19th century London. Menacing figures lurk in darkened alleyways; desperate men with nothing to lose and the determination to take what they can from others. Mutterings abound at the local pubs, working men who can’t even afford their daily bread wish for more and listen to radicals and anarchists preaching fire and revolution. Parentless children, called “Street Arabs” in the East End vernacular, pick pockets and snatch purses from those not Wiley enough to protect their meager funds. In these dangerous streets Saucy Jack, known to the papers as “Jack the Ripper” slew with impunity while Sherlock Holmes battled crime from petty larceny to the machinations of the mastermind Dr. James Moriarty himself. Chinese Tongs battle East End mobs for control of Opium dens and other rackets, all at the behest of their shadowy master, the Devil Doctor.

Meanwhile on the high seas Captain Nemo and his Submarine The Nautilus wage a one man war against British imperialism and perhaps war itself. In the skies Robur the Conqueror makes elaborate plans to rule the world with powerful airships, and who knows what secret powers lurk beneath the Earth’s surface or watch our globe from the sandy wastes of Mars; planning the death of Humanity itself?

All the while, the gentry and social elite live glittering lives amongst champagne and Worth gowns, silk suits and noble titles, living lives of idleness and comfort; thinking nothing of the people beyond their glittering manors and opulent mansions. Whether the Robber Barons of the United States, the Old Nobility of Europe or the teetering monarchies of the Royal Houses themselves the world at the end of the 19th century was a time fraught with change.

Compounded upon this are the emergence of the self styled “SuperMankind”; those of the far future who have found themselves stranded in a past that is and yet isn’t their own. Unable to return to their hone time of the 21st century, they attempt to make a place for themselves in this world alongside those Super Humans who are at home in the 19th century. Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, the Invisible Man, Frankenstein’s Monster and others. Baba Yaga haunts the barren steppes of Russia, and ancient gods of the Near East and America rouse from their millennial slumbers to again walk as gods upon the Earth. Add to this the threats of Dracula, The Martian Invaders and prehistoric worlds and lands that time forgot, and the milieu is a rich panoply of adventure indeed!

220846.name: Neo ATLAS 1469
220846.description:
User Summary

You play the role as the Master of a Trading Company, and your aim is to complete the World Map and tell the world what the "world" really is, via the help of the admirals you hire.

220847.name: elaine
220847.description:
This is elaine! A minimalistic tile-matching action game by Slight Super Powers. In this deceptively simple game, you'll have to deal with a shifting screen, multi-colored patterns of increasing speed and complexity, and an unrelenting countdown timer synced to brain-pumping music.

Source: The Developer Website.

220848.name: Pentaurus: Duel
220848.description:
Pentaurus: Duel is a card game where two players take turns, opponents compete for colonizing planets, building spaceships and conquer satelites.

They have to put cards face up to build their planetary colonies, get spaceships from the market, use action cards from their hand to fight and use their habilities from their races cards.

The sequence of the turn is:
Make the discards, draw cards, play planets and satelites, Spaceship market, play action, facilities and character cards, and launch attacks against enemy planets.

The player who reaches 12 units of pentanium wins the game. This pentanium parts are given for the played cards, planets conquered and satelites owned.

220850.name: Purple Hills
220850.description:
User Summary

Simple platformer in which your wheel jumps over obstacles to exit each screen. After about 10 fairly easy screens this game can be completed.

220851.description:
The world is within your grasp! Can you take it?

Diabolical! is a topsy-turvy tabletop game where you play a supervillain trying to take over the world! To do so, you'll need to complete objectives, called Schemes, to execute the most nefarious plan among your evil compatriots. By effectively managing your resources and commanding your minions to do your bidding, the world will surely be in your grasp!

In Diabolical!, players simultaneously issue Commands to build resources and work toward completing Schemes. Working on Schemes earns a player Victory Points, and completing a Scheme earns a player bonus Victory Points as well as additional rewards. Players attempt to maximize their scheme points each round by effectively anticipating their opponents' actions to complete the most schemes possible.

Players have access to special abilities they can use to disrupt their opponents' plans, or to push themselves toward victory faster!
220851.name: Diabolical!

220852.description: Emblems: NHL is a set-collecting and trick-taking — or hat trick-taking, wink wink — card game that focuses on the grouping of NHL teams and logos. Players call out attributes of specific logos – such as year, Stanley Cups, or colors – and collect as many cards as possible. They can earn additional points along the way by using special in-game and end-game bonus cards that will boost their total score. The player with the highest score wins.
220852.name: Emblems: NHL
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

220853.name: Diamonds and Dinosaurs
220853.description:
Description from te publisher:

Intrepid explorers have landed on a lost island in search of fabulous diamonds! Setting out from their base camp, the explorers hack their way into the jungle in search of the lost gems but will they get attacked by vicious dinosaurs first?

Diamonds and Dinosaurs is a game for 1-5 players where players search a dangerous jungle made from a deck of cards. Depending on the suit played, either a valuable diamond is revealed, a dangerous dinosaur appears, or the player gains a weapon token into their arsenal to help them hack through the jungle or fight off dinosaurs. The player must roll a d12 to determine which jungle spaces are value for movement. Weapon tokens can be added to your dice roll to increase the number. However, fail a roll and your turn is over. The custom "dinosaur die" can make more diamonds appear, move the existing dinosaurs through the jungle or even repopulate the dinosaurs back to the playfield!

These hungry dinosaurs will take an opportunity to bite at you, so be careful where you end your movement! If you get bit, you lose health. If you lose six health, drop your diamonds and return to base camp. Base camp protects players from dinosaurs as well as mystic statues found in the jungle. Or you might find the hidden temple which houses untold riches... and danger! The first player to collect six diamonds wins the game!

220854.name: Wizard's Isle (5E)
220854.description:
From the introduction:

Millennia ago, the powerful archmage Seldorius of Farland built for himself on Hamor Island a compound and fortress where he could do his research undisturbed, and where he could found a council of wise people to combat evil in the world. This was the second Cadre of the Wise. Eventually they interfered with the dreaded Dweller in the Wintervale, a powerful evil personage.

User summary:

For 19th - 20th level characters.

220855.name: Supremacy 2020: Fortuna 2020
220855.description:
From the publisher's site:

This expansion brings the Minor Powers to life. Minors will now trade on the market, build on their own, seize your factories and even invade their neighbors!

Deadly Virus Outbreaks will also appear. Don’t ignore them too long or they may spread into a world wide pandemic that destroys the planet.

Requires Supremacy 2020, and BRIC Minor Powers expansion.

220856.name: Pinball FX2 - Aliens vs. Pinball
220856.description:
Aliens vs. Pinball is comprised of three distinct tables. In Aliens pinball, team up with the Colonial Marines as Ellen Ripley on a pinball table based on ALIENS, the 1986 blockbuster film. Face your fears and take on a deadly Alien threat on the Sevastopol Space Station as Amanda Ripley in the Alien: Isolation pinball table and feel the rush of the hunt as a young Yautja warrior in Alien vs. Predator pinball.

Featuring characters from the hit film franchise including Ellen Ripley, Aliens vs. Pinball offers a dynamic interpretation of the terrifying atmosphere and white-knuckle situations that have made the ALIEN anthology one of the most popular, frightening and enduring franchises in science-fiction.

Key Game Features

Join Ellen Ripley as she confronts her nightmares and help the Colonial Marines rid LV-426 of its Alien infestation in Aliens Pinball
Watch out for the merciless Alien stalking you on the Alien: Isolation pinball table
Defeat Xenomorphs and rise in Yautja society on the Alien vs. Predator table
Original iconic voiceovers and sound effects from films and videogames set in the ALIENS Universe
Leaderboards, score tracking, exciting social features, and more

Source: The Developer Website.

220857.name: Follow
220857.description:
A quantum vortex is rearranging reality... history and fantasy are being jumbled together and somebody needs to untangle the mess! You must find the lost people and creatures then get them to follow you back to their homes. Lead enough followers to safety and you might just be able to destroy the vortex and rescue reality!

Follow is a tile/card matching game based on strategy and luck.
Players create a different board each time by joining together the hex-tiles (111mm max. width) as the game progresses. Each hex shows a different location and in each location there is a 'follower' card (45x63mm).

The locations and characters are well known from history or fantasy but are randomly mixed. The objective is to lead these famous faces to their specific places. For example; you could find a bewildered Dracula in the Wild West and lead him through Ancient Egypt and Camelot to reach his Transylvanian home.

The rules provide a choice of actions each turn, such as exploring new locations and stealing followers from other players as well as the opportunity to have several turns in a row, allowing players to plan strategies.

The followers and locations are colour-coded as yellow, green, blue, purple and red. To win the game a player has to return one follower of each colour to the safety of their specific locations. Upon achieving this feat the player must then succeed a dice roll called the 'Gizmotron roll' in order to reset reality and therefore be declared as the winner.

An eight page (A5) 'Instruction Manual' gives rules for 2 to 6 players aged 8 to adult. A standard game comprises 30 'follower' cards, 30 corresponding location hex-tiles, 6 'vortex' hex-tiles and lasts from 20 to 60 mins, depending on the number of players. The game is made quicker and easier by reducing the number of follower cards involved, along with their location hexes.

220859.name: Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion
220859.description:
The tavern is open and business is booming, but like your drinks, the competition is stiff! Time to employ some dirty tactics to ensure your tavern remains the best in town!

Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion adds in 48 Dirty Deeds cards, as well as a handful of new Tavern and Patron cards, to help you get the edge on your competitors! With this Expansion, intended mostly for Competitive Play, the cards add in a "take that" element to game play.

Dump a bag of rats in your opponent's back door to taint their food, or hire a thug to poison their ale! Spread rumors to scare away their patrons, or rig your games to earn more gold!

Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds is a great way to up the stakes between players by letting them target one another and pull some nasty pranks, from the light-hearted to the downright devious!

220860.name: InQuest Gamer (Issue 78 - Oct 2001)
220860.description:
On the cover:
Buffy Card Game: Exclusive Card Inside
The Lord of the Rings Movie Issue!
Tons of Photos!
20 Questions with Gandalf!
Secrets of the Orcs!
D&D First Ever Complete Price Guide

220861.description:
Take and Trade commodities in the Baltic Sea to acquire more power than your opponents in the main cities of the 13th Century!

At the beginning of each round commodity cards are randomly grouped to packages with a minimum base value. Their value vary from 2 to 5. Buildings (cards) are placed on the table too.
Each player takes two turns per round, the first on in clockwise order, the second one counterclockwise.
Your turn starts with choosing a group of commodity cards OR one building from the display in the middle of the table. Then you may build up to three buildings from your hand. To build you must pay the costs by discarding your commodities. Depending on where you build (color of the building indicates the city), your commodities have a different value. Usually the commodity have their base value, but in every city, one commodity is not wanted at all and another one is more expensive. For example, in Gdansk you cannot pay with grain, but glass has a value +2.
The buildings show victory points and persons. They also have different features to help you getting more commodities, create more Victory Points or build easier by giving money per merchant on your cards etc.

In Riga players react on what the common display in the middle of the table offers. Who will be able to acquire the most Victory Points from his opportunities?

Riga continues the series of small games from Ostia in the Baltic Sea following Visby and Tallinn.
220861.name: Riga

220862.name: Tavern Masters: Games Of Chance Mini-Expansion
220862.description:
The tavern has been drawing in more interesting characters, and with each one a new set of possibilities!

Tavern Masters: Games Of Chance Mini-Expansion adds in 20 new Tavern, Patron, and Dirty Deed cards; each utilizing a dice-rolling mechanic to add a touch of randomness to the card's ability.

A fun way to introduce some variable-powered Patrons, Goods and Staff, plus each expansion comes with a custom pair of Tavern Masters six-sided dice!

220863.description:
Levitate is a new spell card for Rock Paper Wizard.

The image shows a hand showing "thumbs up" and the text reads:
"Target advances 1, then caster advances 1 per wizard closer to the hoard"

Instead of having a card number in the lower right corner, the card is marked "promo" there.
220863.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Rock Paper Wizard – Levitate

220864.name: Harpy, Imp, Medusa
220864.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

In this release of the Monster Classes series, you have the opportunity to play as three different monstrous races - the harpy, imp, and medusa! As a member of these monster races, your experience playing in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is sure to be unique and filled with unexpected situations.

This book includes three monster classes - the harpy, imp, and medusa, along with the associated feats necessary to build interesting characters, that at the same time are true to the concept presented in the Bestiary.

220865.name: Faerie Circle Stalker
220865.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Faerie Circle Stalker CR 14
2 New Magic Items: Stranglewhip, Vest of the Seasons
7 Natural Item: Couatl Headdress, Dragonfly Wing, Mandragora Essence Tea, Owlbear Beak, Peryton Shadowpelt, Quickwood Root Stake, Shocker Horn Trap

220866.name: Warlocks and Devilborn
220866.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Tired of the mundane life of a peasant? Yearn for a life of adventure? Sure you do! Never swung a sword? No problem! Never one for divine inspiration or slinging spells? No Problem! The horns? Well, yes, about that. See, my associates and I represent the Hells and…what? Oh no, no, no, you’re not dead and you’re not going to hell. You see, I’ve come to make a deal. I need someone to represent my interests on this plane and.."

Introducing the Warlock for Dungeon World, a new class supplement that includes new moves for Pact Magic, Patron Gifts, and Familiars. We’re also excited to debut the Devilborn race for Dungeon World as well, adding new rules for the classes found within the Dungeon World Core book. Relish all that is hellish and pick this supplement up today!

220867.name: Poisons, Spices, & Vices
220867.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting Poisons, Spices, & Vices For Dungeon World; a supplment that let's you "stimulate" the extra details that matter in your game. Wheather Parleying, Carousing, or Hacking and Slashing, we could all use a little extra something to spice things up, so pick this supplement up today!

220868.name: The Death Knight
220868.description:
From publisher blurb:

You woke up to a battlefield that was devoid of anyone standing and pulled the spear out of your stomach, watching the wound close after. The bodies of your fallen comrades all around you stare to the ground as if looking for the answer to the question of why you have arisen. You once knew their names in addition to your own, but no longer.. You once had a family, a home, and other details that gave you purpose, but those memories were all taken away prior to your rebirth. Now, you wander Dungeon World trying to rediscover your old purpose or to discover what your new one is. Where you may have once brandished the virtues of honor, justice, and mercy, they have now been replaced with slaughter, unrighteousness, and bitter cold. Arise, Death Knight!

The Death Knight For Dungeon World: We’re going to cut to it..we set out to create the Death Knight class in the world’s most popular MMO video game for use in Dungeon World. Although the class in said MMO has changed over time (for the worst, in our opinion) we tried to faithfully represent the class abilities when the class was first rolled out almost ten years ago using Dungeon World mechanics. If you are looking to add a little darkness to your class selection, pick this supplement up today!

220869.name: The Coriolis Peril
220869.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs must retrieve an object from a starship crash site during a ferocious storm. Can they succeed in their mission while facing death from both the elements outside of the ship and a surprise within it?

The Coriolis Peril is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

220870.name: The Cavalry
220870.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here We Come to Save the Day!

There is battle, and then there is warfare. Many adventurers are familiar with wading into combat against monsters and small groups of enemies, but this is nothing next to the glory and chaos and carnage that is true war. More than simply a change in scale, the difference between war and other combat can be profound. In a war, the characters are part of something larger than themselves, contributing to the efforts of their armies, or perhaps leading those armies themselves. The priorities of a soldier are different from those of an adventurer, and often the challenges that they face are, as well. While many characters can translate their talents as adventurers to the battlefield, one who specifically focuses on warfare and battlefield tactics will have the edge on others when it comes to true war. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Archetypes of War provides six new war-themed archetypes for a variety of classes.

For this book, we focus on cavalry, mounted soldiers whose power and speed make them versatile and effective units in any military battle. Whether they are lightly-armored and trained for speed and maneuverability, harrying opposing forces on their flanks and then retreating before they can retaliate, or whether they use the raw power and momentum of their charging steeds to deliver devastating routs against enemies who are trampled underfoot, this book provides archetypes that highlight the roles of cavalry in warfare. This book contains the following archetypes.

The mounted harrier, a cavalier archetype that focuses on crushing foes underhoof with devastating charges.
The wild knight, a druid archetype whose animal companion serves as a fearsome mount, carrying her into battle with incredible ferocity.
The spirit rider, a shaman archetype that trades in a traditional familiar for a more powerful animal companion, which serves as a mount and carries its rider through the spirit realm, as well as gaining special boons based on her spirit.
The pale rider, a spiritualist archetype that imitates the grim reaper, riding a phantom steed and delivering a frightful gaze to horrify her foes.
The otherworld cavalry, a summoner archetype whose eidolon not only serves as a powerful mount, but can carry him and other riders across the planes.
A bonus archetype for the warlord, from Path of War by Dreamscarred Press, the daring rider applies the same tactical gambits as other warlords to a mounted style of combat.

220871.name: Disturbance in Longsaddle
220871.description:
From the introduction:

While in the town of Longsaddle after completing a simple job, you find yourself in the midst of a disturbance occurring in the usually quiet town. What would you do? Help the town? Or maybe make a few coins at the town expenses? It’s up to you to decide.

User summary:

For a single 1st - 3rd level character.

220872.name: 20 Orc Feats
220872.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Legend returns with an all-new take on Orc Feats! Within these pages are orc feats that will breathe life into your orc NPCs, adversaries and orc or half-orc player characters. This PDF is also fully bookmarked and extensively hyperlinked to the rules on the d20pfsrd website!

220873.name: Relics of Shulsharthilarkar
220873.description:
From the introduction:

Among the waterways of Dark Lake, the PCs stumble upon an ornate structure that is not quite empty. Will they survive the encounter with the servants of an ancient aboleth that once called Dark Lake home?

A short dungeon to be inserted in Out of the Abyss, for five 3rd-4th level characters.

220874.name: Shunned Valley of the Three Tombs (Collector's Edition)
220874.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible adventure designed for 1st-level characters by Creighton Broadhurst

Far from the nearest town, hidden deep in the forest, lies a marshy, boggy valley. Woodsmen and hunters shun the place—kept away by rumours of a terrible beast lairing within and of a ghost haunting the valley’s boggy mere. But, as well as great danger, treasures magical and mundane may yet lie unclaimed in the valley for three unexplored tombs built by ancient hands, stand amid the mud and reeds. Dare you explore the Shunned Valley of the Three Tombs?

This collector's edition also contains extensive details of the town of Dulwich--a perfect base from which the PCs can launch their exploration

220875.name: Lofty Pursuits
220875.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a series of successful exploits you and your associates decide it is time for a nice vacation. You pull into the large city of Breckengarden to take a few weeks off when you are approached by a courier. After a clandestine meeting you are informed that several well-known adventurers have been disappearing and the party has been asked to resolve the issue. The bigger problem is the likely source of the kidnappings is the master of the Cloud Giant kingdom that floats above the ground!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 4-6 PCs of 8th – 10th level.

rpg: Ninja High School the Anime & Manga Role Playing Game
220876.name: Ninja High School the Anime & Manga Role Playing Game
220876.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ninja High School (also known as NHS) is a comic book series created, written, and illustrated by Ben Dunn, and currently published by Antarctic Press. It was at first published by Eternity Comics. On occasion other artists and writers have contributed to the series including Carlos Kastro, Eric Meheu and Fabian Doles. It is currently being developed into a Feature Film by Perfect Circle Productions.

NHS takes place in a suburban town known as Quagmire, located "Somewhere in the Midwest". The series originally centers on the misadventures of one Jeremy Feeple, a 16-year-old boy attending Quagmire High School, an alien princess named Asrial from a planet called Salusia, and a young female ninja named Ichi-Kun Ichihonei, from Japan.

Originally intended as a mini-series, the comic hit such a boom of popularity that it became a full series, currently totaling over 160 issues (as well as two mini-series, "Ninja High School V2" and "Quagmire USA" and the color mini-series "The Prom Formula"). There have also been two-issue furry parodies which went by the name "Furry Ninja High School" and "Furry Ninja High School Strikes Back". Fan-contributed editions of the series include the "Ninja High School Yearbook" and "Ninja High School Swimsuit Edition".

This new D6 based role playing game puts you in the center seat, it allows you to control what is happening in your own version of the Ninja High School comic. Your imagination, this book, a pencil, some paper, and some dice are all that are needed for you to tell the story you have always wanted to tell. This is the first official RPG in its thirty year history.

220877.name: Rajas of the Ganges
220877.description: India in the 16th century. The empire is ruled by the Great Mogul Akbar; the countless provinces, however, are under the control of the local Hindu princes, the rajas. The rajas compete with each other for power and prestige. Hinduism and the caste system shape people's lives. Taking on the role of rajas, players control the destiny of their princedom and develop their province by using the caste system, trading with goods, and traveling along the Ganges. But the Gods also influence their fate. Good karma, but also other ways lead to wealth and fame.

220878.name: Feuville
220878.description: In Feuville, the player-builders construct a city and must then use spells to defend it against the regular attacks of a dragon.

220879.name: Legacy of the Force Sourcebook
220879.description:
From the book's back cover:

The Legacy of the Force Sourcebook is a compendium for use with the Star Wars Saga Edition and Star Wars D6 rulesets.

Explore the events featured in Betrayal, Bloodlines, Tempest, Exile, Sacrifice, Inferna, Fury, Revolution, and Invincible.

The Lagacy of the Force Sourcebook contains complete stats and write-ups for returning characters Dark Lady Lumiya, Boba Fett, Lando Calrissian, Thracken Sal-Solo, and Natasi Daala, amongst others.

Features stats and write-ups for new starships previously unseen in other sourcebooks.

220880.name: Hollowild Gorge & Caves
220880.description:
From publisher blurb:

Miles from the road that cuts through the ancient forest is a secret and untouched place - Hollowild Gorge. Cut down into the rock by ancient rivers, the gorge is now heavily forested and covered with lush greenery. Weathering has eaten into the walls of the gorge and created numerous caves - just perfect for exploring!
Hollowild Gorge & Caves is a printable RPG floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.
Contents: A 20x30 battlemap depicting the surface. A forested woodland valley, with trees and undergrowth covering the sides. The floor of the valley is sandy and clear, but the cliffs are covered in trees, punctuated at various points by cave entrances. The set also includes 13 cave battlemaps (of various sizes) which can be used as the caves inside any of the entrances on the surface.

The cave maps include several empty generic caves, as well as a pool, entrance to a dungeon, bandit camp, huge hole, treasure horde and more.

The Discover Range features large surface battlemaps and smaller underground rooms and chambers. When your party discover an entrance to the underground, simply use the underground map of your choice. It can be different every time.

220881.name: Races of Everglow
220881.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's easy to be distracted by the colorful ponies that have laid dominion over the world of Everglow, but they are far from the only race that has carved out their own portion of things and demands recognition. From the whimsical flutterponies to the despised impure, these lesser races are given a chance to be known, from social mores to combat abilities.

This Book Includes

Two New Races!
Take control of the gem gnolls, if they’ll let you. Seek treasure at all costs, or perhaps look for a better way?
The donkies of Everglow were not given a fair shake. The impure are prejudiced against harshly, but under your guidance, perhaps they can find justice, or at least peace.





As Well As:

Dozens of feats
Many new spells
Compatible with both Pathfinder and the 5th edition of the most popular roleplaying game
Detailed looks into the lives of each race, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in your character.

220883.name: Armoured Storm 1942
220883.description:
A tank versus tank combat game, played on a hex grid with pre-painted tanks. Set in the Desert War of WW2 (in 1942), the tanks in the box are the British Crusader, British/American Lee/Grant, German Panzer III, and German Panzer IV.

Players compete to choose tactics on the Tactics Board, allowing them to move, shoot, repair tanks, and take better aimed shots at their opponents.

Six model tanks are included for each side, and the game comes complete with dice, markers, terrain tiles and a gameboard.

220885.name: Battle Ravens
220885.description:
Battle Ravens is an abstract game of Viking Age shieldwall warfare: a brutal clash of strength and cunning, where subtlety and nuance are neither welcome nor commonplace.

You need to out-think and out-batter your opponent to break his or her shieldwall and thus his or her army.

You do so by choosing whether to command your battle line to attack, defend, or redeploy strength to another part of your shieldwall.

Commands are given through the use of Raven counters - wherever the ravens fly, battle will occur!

220886.name: Skellsholm
220886.description:
From publisher blurb:

The town of Skellsholm is an important port of call for ships heading north. It stands on a peninsula jutting out into the Skell River and protects the area from western attacks, as well as providing a stopping point for traders and merchants heading north along the Kispacian Sea. For fans of the "Castles and Keeps" books, this stand alone location holds details of the town and castle with maps and descriptions. While designed for the Mhâr Fantasy RPG, all of our locations are suitable for any similar game setting.

220887.name: The Kingdom of Aukland
220887.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small island kingdom of Audora, more commonly called Aukland by its neighbours, is the smallest and most open of the Nicilan Kingdoms toward humanity. Strange ruins dot the isles, sometimes surrendering secrets of the ancient Nicila or unspeakable horrors. The Kingdom of Aukland Regional Sourcebooks is the third Kingdom book for the Mhâr Fantasy Role Playing Game and the first one to be set in the Northlands of Durine. Though written for the Mhâr Fantasy RPG, all the material within is playable with any fantasy RPG.

220888.name: The Gazetteer of Durine
220888.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world setting of Mhar Fantasy RPG and lands beyond the Kingdom of Anaeland are now compiled in this 100+ page volume with a guide to the the various regions and kingdoms which make up the island continent of Durine. With the volume is a large, full colour continental map.

220889.name: The City of Aquile
220889.description:
From publisher blurb:

The City of Aquile Urban Campaign Module is a full city setting for a detailed urban campaign. At 69 pages, including a full colour map, it has amazing detail of the city and its people. While designed for the Mhar Fantasy RPG, it is easily used in any similar fantasy platform.

220890.name: The Well of Arwan
220890.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Well of Arwan is an adventure module set in the Mhâr fantasy RPG universe and playable in any regular fantasy RPG setting. Players will be set upon an adventure that will bring them in contact with the Hood and see them explore the long buried ritual site of an ancient druidic cult as a Necromancer and his servants seek to unlock the gates to the underworld. This module includes the setting details of Malsprydd Castle and rules for introducing Necromancy to the game.

220891.name: The Kingdom of Gwythia Regional Sourcebook
220891.description:
From publisher blurb:

The proud Kelta who inhabit the Kingdom of Gwythia have withstood repeated attempts by outsiders to take their lands and they have endured. Unified under the guidance of their High King, the kingdom continues to oppose the imperialist dreams of its neighbour, the Kingdom of Anæland. But the unity of Gwythia is fragile. Some prosper from trade and industry while others starve trying to scratch an existence from the rugged landscape of this unforgiving land. Clan rivalries and blood feuds run deep among the families that rule the land and strange supernatural forces tamper with frail human fate... This book also covers Gwythia’s neighbour to the south, the small forest kingdom of Frisia. Settled by invaders from the north, Frisia inhabitants dwell between the unrelenting sea and the impenetrable forest. The kingdom is a confederation of noble families and powerful guild clans that have become legendary merchants and mariners. This Sourcebook not only includes an overview of the politics, culture, religion and history of the region, but also includes an extensive alphabetical index with entries providing information on locations, historical figures and important aspects of the region and world of Mhar. This book is a sourcebook based on the Mhâr Fantasy RPG, but is general and accessible enough to be used in any medieval-based role playing game.

220892.name: The City of Halisburgh
220892.description:
From publisher blurb:

The City of Halisburgh is a follow-up to the City of Livry and the two Castles & Keep modules covering the second most powerful city within the Kingdom of Anæland and the heart of political power for the Southern Lords in their struggle with the increasingly autocratic Royal Court in Livry. While written as part of the setting for Mhâr Fantasy RPG, Halisburgh is a stand-alone book and can be adapted by the Game Master for his own fantasy setting or RPG rule system.

220893.name: Hunters of the Moor
220893.description:
From publisher blurb:

The village of Brandywell on the edge of the High Moors in Brunumshire lies shivering in terror as ghostly raiders thunder across the moorlands. Shepherds and tin-miners have vanished and Brandywell's chandler has been carried off into the night in an attack on the village. Now his cousin seeks brave adventurers to unravel the mystery of the *Hunters of the Moor*. The first published adventure for the *Mhar Fantasy RPG*, it also contains notes on converting the module to some of your Favorite fantasy role- playing games.

220894.name: Knights of the Golden Eagle
220894.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knights of the Golden Eagle is a sourcebook for players and game masters using the Golden eagle and other mercenary armies in the Mhâr Fantasy RPG and other similar themed role playing games. The history, organization and personalities of the Knights are described in this useful hand book. Also found in its pages is information for the care and deployment of medieval armies and mercenary bands. Rules for hiring soldiers and mass combat rule, as they pertain to the Mhâr Fantasy RPG are also detailed. The Knights of the Golden Eagle began as an order dedicated to the freeing the Dacian lands from the yoke of the pagan Thindors in the imperial and religious wars that swept Durine. Now the Order has returned to Dacia to serve the Republic of Varia and the other wealthy city-states as elite mercenaries whole fighting skills and absolute loyalty can be bought - for the right price.

220895.name: Castles & Keeps of Gwythia
220895.description:
From publisher blurb:

Using the same format as the very successful Castles and Keeps of Anaeland, Castles and Keeps of Gwythia examines in detail seven fortifications in the land south of Anaeland. Included are colour maps of the villages and towns surrounding the foritified building, commercial and industrial appraisals, and some local folklore to add to the possibilities. The history of each site provides sufficient background information to create a setting of intrigue and adventure.

220896.name: The Fraterna Solesti
220896.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fraterna Solesti is one of the primary Magi Orders in the Mhâr Fantasy RPG. This ambitious source book gives a wealth of information about the Order and it's function within the Orders and the world around them. While the book is designed for the MhÃ¢r setting, its information would be invaluable to any magic based medieval setting RPG. From the beginnings of magic in the world, to the politics and intrigues of the current Magi Orders, the book outlines the history of the Orders. It offers archetypes and new skills and merits; spells and artifacts; optional rules; personalities for non player characters; secrets to uncover; and even an undead magess bent on revenge. The use of a magical college as a background for a character's academic study of magic allows a character to have contacts and connections within the magic community. It allows for friends and enemies formed while the character was learning. The Fraterna Solesti sourcebook details one college and provides indepth information that would allow a Game Master to use the school in any similar setting. The sourcebook also aids in the creation of unique chantries for magic study.

220897.name: Azardar's Wondrous Emporium: Cloaks and Mantles
220897.description:
From publisher blurb:

Azardar's Wondrous Emporium is a unique shop carrying a collection of goods for the adventurous character. This premiere issue, Cloaks and Mantles, looks at a range of artifacts in this category. Designed for Mhar, but easily used in any medieval/high fantasy RPG setting.

220898.name: Azardar's Wondrous Emporium: Boots and Shoes
220898.description:
From publisher blurb:

Azardar's Wondrous Emporium is a unique shop carrying a collection of goods for the adventurous character. This second volume, Boots and Shoes, looks at a range of artifacts in this category. Designed for Mhar, but easily used in any medieval/high fantasy RPG setting.

220899.name: Apparitions
220899.description:
From publisher blurb:

An apparition is an undead spirit whose primary attack generates fear in those who encounter them. According to the speculations of some sages on the nature of unquiet spirits, ghosts can be divided into five classifications based upon characteristics of their powers and the nature of their haunting. Written for the Mhar Fantasy RPG, Apparitions can be used in any similar fantasy setting RPG.

220900.name: Apes & Monkeys
220900.description:
From publisher blurb:

Apes and Monkeys is a small addition to the Mhar Fantasy RPG. While not native to the Mhar setting on the continent of Durine, they are sometimes kept as pets by the upper echelons and they appear in various lore around the nations.

220901.name: Animates
220901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creations of inert material, Animates are enchanted by magic users and priests to give them a semblance of life. Animates have no independent life of their own. Their animation is due to the instillation of an elemental spirit. Animates are not to be confused with Golems and Gargoyles. Written for the Mhar Fantasy RPG, Animates can be used in any similar fantasy setting RPG.

220902.name: Eshby
220902.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small location product for use in Mhar or similar game systems. A minor thran located on the southern borders of the Kingdom of Osmark, Eshby is a lonely coastal settlement sitting at the edge of the inhospitable Trollfens.

220903.name: Calygraunt
220903.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bestiary entry for the Mhr Fantasy RPG or similar setting games, this is not your Bugs type of bunny creature. The Calygraunt is 3 feet long and has antlers. It is an enchanted creature, and as such is wary of mortals. Tribal soothsayers and mages alike hold to the belief that the antlers of the calygraunt hold magical powers.

220904.name: La Carrière
220904.description:
From publisher blurb:

La Carrière is a small stand alone product belonging to the Mhâr Fantasy RPG's Castles and Keeps product line. La Carrière is a fortress settlement at the northern edge of the Duchy of Orleons. It is an area where marble is quarried and the fort serves as protection and oversight for the area.

220905.name: Fumiko!
220905.description:
You are an artificial intelligence named Fumiko. You managed to escape the testing grounds and voices are telling you where to go. A surreal world is unfolding. Everything is unknown to you in a dystopian network of 2080.

Source: The Game Website.

220906.name: City of Rott: Streets of Rott
220906.description:
Brawl your way through hordes of decay in the Streets of Rott, an arcade style, side-scrolling beat ‘em up. Featuring a skull-smashing arsenal of fighting moves, weaponry and vehicles, play as an old man with a walker, a tough guy with a circular saw or a mysterious woman, and bring peace to the City.

Source: The Game Website.

220907.name: Monkey Land 3D: Reaper Rush
220907.description:
Monkey Land 3D: Reaper Rush is 100% full of gameplay! There's bananas, treasure coins, Piggys in need of saving, locked treasure chests and thats just in the first 10 seconds! Find new abilities like the butt-stompy by finding the precious Dinosaur Feathers!

Source: The Game Website.

220908.name: Canvas The Gallery
220908.description:
Use spraypaint to paint whatever you want in a blank art gallery. Send your galleries to your friends for them to view your artwork.

Source: The Developer Website.

220909.name: Herald: An Interactive Period Drama – Book I & II
220909.description:
Herald is a choice-driven adventure set during colonial times. Board the HLV Herald and uncover its dark secrets in an intriguing tale about tyranny and servitude.

Source: The Game Website.

220910.name: Circles
videogamehonor: 2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
220910.description:
Circles is an abstract puzzle game that takes your mind off things. No words, no distractions: an invitation to experiment. Relax, let your mind wander and discover the puzzling possibilities of circles.

Source: The Game Website.

220911.name: Pixel Puzzles Junior
220911.description:
Pixel Puzzles Junior, The perfect puzzle game for kids.

Source: The Developer Website.

220912.name: Munch VR
220912.description:
Help Munch become the biggest fish in the sea by grubbing your way up the food chain in a virtual reality where big eats small!

Source: The Game Website.

220913.description:
Description from the publisher:

You feel it just below the surface. Something gnawing at the edges of society, an ancient being that could so easily erase the steady march of machines and concrete that have come to be recognized as progress in the modern world. Your visions show you a desolate future, where all that remains is dust, ash, and those who have long-slumbered.

Violent earthquakes contort cities to unrecognizable ruin, torrential typhoons eradicate coastlines, and deep below the the Earth, something ancient stirs.

Shudde M’ell, The Cataclysm from Below, approaches with destruction and ruin as his heralds.

Cities in Ruin brings four new investigators, and a slew of new monster and encounter cards to the world of Eldritch Horror. New Ancient One Shudde M’ell’s presence brings a destructive twist to the game in the form of deadly disasters.
220913.name: Eldritch Horror: Cities in Ruin

220914.name: Land of Medievals: Mounts & Armor
220914.description:
Mounts & Armor is a 42 card expansion set for Land of Medievals.
This expansion brings you two new types of cards and expands the
game difficulty, gameplay time and strategies.
each mount type has different skills and the army units can now earn and wear epic armors to block and deflect received damages.

220916.name: The GM's Handbook
220916.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This sourcebook contains 13 chapters of material for your games and covers a large portion of the material available at TORIS.

220918.name: Asian Bloodlines
220918.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood Magic of the East

Asian Bloodlines brings you an awesome array of new options for spontaneous spellcasters in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Gamecampaign, drawn from the myths and legends of fantasy Asia! Inside you'll find over 20 dynamic and exciting bloodlines for sorcerers and bloodragers alike! Whether your heroes are descended from the clever kitsune or the treacherous kappa, the friendly and protective kami spirits or the seductively sinister rakshasa, or the imperial dragons that span every part of the alignment spectrum, you'll find options here for you. Feathered tengu sword saints and noble naga bloodlines stand alongside those of the savage oni or the imperious descendants of kings and emperors, with mutated bloodlines for kitsune, nagas, and oni as well! If you want to bring a touch of the Orient to sorcery in your campaign, Asian Bloodlines is your ticket to ride! Grab this 26-page Pathfinder magic supplement today and Make Your Game Legendary!

220919.name: RuneQuest Playtest Manuscript
220919.description:
Publisher blurb:

The RuneQuest Playtest Manuscript book is a 250+ page hardcover book created from high-resolution scans of the original playtest manuscript, which has been lovingly kept in a binder for the last 40 years. The book also features newly written introductory essays by Steve Perrin and Greg Stafford.

220921.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.11 - Nov 2016)
220921.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Misfit Studios November 2016 Newsletter

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.
The Misfit Studios November 2016 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

Modern Gear Guide: Firearm Ammunition
Eric Lofgren Presents: Charging Dwarf
Earl Geier Presents: Leaping Axeman
Scott Harshbarger Presents: The Getaway
Jason Moser Presents: All the World's a Stage
Christina Stiles Presents: Winter Hunter by Jacob Blackmon
Earl Geier Presents: Scarecrow Man
Eric Lofgren Presents: Jolly Friar
Jason Moser Presents: Wasteland Storm
Scott Harshbarger Presents: Leap of Faith

220922.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 3.12 - Dec 2016)
220922.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Misfit Studios December 2016 Newsletter

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.
The Misfit Studios December 2016 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

Eric Lofgren Presents: Red Dragon Lair
Earl Geier Presents: Tower Lurker
Jason Moser Presents: Face of History
Scott Harshbarger Presents: Scarlett Sky
Christina Stiles Presents: Dagger Dancer by Jacob Blackmon
Eric Lofgren Presents: Wind Mage

220923.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 4.01 - Jan 2017)
220923.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Misfit Studios January 2017 Newsletter

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.
The Misfit Studios January 2017 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

W Fraser Sandercombe Presents: Conjured Dragon
Eric Lofgren Presents: Yeti
Earl Geier Presents: Wild Hag
Jason Moser Presents: The Man Who Watched the World End
Christina Stiles Presents: Frigid Weretiger by Jacob Blackmon
Eric Lofgren Presents: Dragon Sword
Scott Harshbarger Presents: Dire Rat
Lots of Horror: Hecate's Mirror for Savage Worlds
Strange Brew: Book of Shadows

220924.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 4.02 - Feb 2017)
220924.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Misfit Studios February 2017 Newsletter

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.
The Misfit Studios February 2017 Newsletter Contains Release Details on:

Earl Geier Presents: Death Birds
Eric Lofgren Presents: Female Sorceress
W Fraser Sandercombe Presents: Lost in the Snow
Jason Moser Presents: Viral Mythology
$layers: The Dead of Night
Earl Geier Presents: Trickster Tinker
Eric Lofgren Presents: Hairy Brute
Jason Moser Presents: Pulled by Fate
W Fraser Sandercombe Presents: Dragon Master
